content.text: The remainder obtained when the polynomial \(\mathrm{p}(x) = x^{3} + ax^{2} - 3x + b\) is divided by \(x + 3\) is twice the remainder obtained when \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divided by \(x - 2\). Given also that \(\mathrm{p}(x)\) is divisible by \(x + 1\), find the value of \(a\) and of \(b\)
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{dy}}{\mathrm{dx}}\)
Hence find the equation of the tangent to the curve \(y = 4 + 5\sin 3x\) at the point where \(x = \frac{\pi}{3}\)
A curve has equation \(y = 4 + 5\sin 3x\)
Simplify \(\frac{(3 + 2\sqrt{5})(6 - 2\sqrt{5})}{(4 - \sqrt{5})}\), giving your answer in the form \(a + b\sqrt{5}\), where \(a\) and \(b\) are
integers
In this part, all lengths are in centimetres
The diagram shows the triangle \(ABC\) with \(AB = 6 - 2\sqrt{3}\) and \(BC = 6 + 2\sqrt{3}\). Given that
\(\cos ABC = -\frac{1}{2}\), find the length of \(AC\) in the form \(c\sqrt{d}\), where \(c\) and \(d\) are integers
Do not use a calculator in this question
Find the values of \(x\) for which \(y\) is not defined
Find \(\frac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}\)
Hence find the approximate increase in \(y\) when \(x\) increases from 2 to \(2 + h\), where \(h\) is small.
It is given that \(y = \frac{\ln(4x^2 - 1)}{x + 2}\)
Find the value of each of \(n, a\) and \(b\)
Hence find the term independent of \(x\) in the expansion of \(\left(2 + ax\right)^n \left(x - \frac{1}{x}\right)^2\)
The first 3 terms in the expansion of \((2 + ax)^{n}\) are equal to \(1024 - 1280x + bx^{2}\), where \(n, a\) and \(b\) are constants
Find \(\overrightarrow{AC}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{OM}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{OM}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{b}\)
Find \(5\mathbf{a} + 10\mathbf{c}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{b}\)
Find \(\overrightarrow{AB}\) in terms of \(\mathbf{a}\) and \(\mathbf{c}\), giving your answer in its simplest form

The diagram shows the quadrilateral \(OABC\) such that \(\overrightarrow{OA} = \mathbf{a}\), \(\overrightarrow{OB} = \mathbf{b}\) and \(\overrightarrow{OC} = \mathbf{c}\). It is given that \(AM:MC = 2:1\) and \(OM:MB = 3:2\)
Find the values of \(a\) for which \(\det \left(\begin{array}{ll}2a & 1\\ 4a & a \end{array}\right) = 6 - 3a.\)
Find \(\mathbf{A}^{-1}\)
Hence find the matrix \(\mathbf{C}\) such that \(\mathbf{AC} = \mathbf{B}\)
It is given that \(\mathbf{A} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 1 \\ 3 & 4 \end{pmatrix}\) and \(\mathbf{B} = \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 0 \\ -3 & 5 \end{pmatrix}\)
Find the \(2 \times 2\) matrix \(\mathbf{D}\) such that \(4\mathbf{D} + 3\mathbf{I} = \mathbf{O}\)
Find \(x\) in terms of \(t\)
Find the value of \(t\) when the acceleration of \(P\) is zero
Find the velocity of \(P\) when the acceleration is zero

A particle \(P\), moving in a straight line, passes through a fixed point \(O\) at time \(t = 0\) s. At time \(t\) s after leaving \(O\), the displacement of the particle is \(x\) m and its velocity is \(v\) ms\(^{- 1}\), where \(v = 12\mathrm{e}^{2t} - 48t, t \geqslant 0\)
Transform this relationship into straight line form
Hence, by plotting a suitable graph, show that the relationship \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{bx}\) is correct
Use your graph to find the value of \(A\) and of \(b\)
Estimate the value of \(x\) when \(y = 500\)
Estimate the value of \(y\) when \(x = 5\)
The table shows values of the variables \(x\) and \(y\)
The relationship between \(x\) and \(y\) is thought to be of the form \(y = A\mathrm{e}^{bx}\), where \(A\) and \(b\) are constants
Find the \(x\)-coordinate of \(A\) and of \(B\)
Write down the coordinates of \(C\) and of \(D\)
Showing all your working, find the area of the shaded region

The diagram shows the graph of \(y = (x + 2)^2 (1 - 3x)\). The curve has a minimum at the point \(A\), a maximum at the point \(B\) and intersects the \(y\)-axis and the \(x\)-axis at the points \(C\) and \(D\) respectively
